name: $\Spec \mathcal{C}^\infty(\RR)$

proofs.integral: The ring $\mathcal{C}^\infty(\RR)$ contains zero divisors, e.g. let $f$ and $g$ be any smooth functions on $\RR$ satisfying $f(-x) = g(x) = 0$ for $x \ge 0$ and $f(1) = g(-1) = 1$, then $fg = 0$.
proofs.locally-noetherian: The ascending chain of ideals $I_n = \{ f \in \mathcal{C}^\infty(\RR) \mid f(x) = 0 \textup{ for } |x| < 1/n \}$ does not stabilize.
proofs.reduced: If $f^n = 0$ for some $f \in \mathcal{C}^\infty(\RR)$ and $n \ge 1$, then $f$ must be $0$.

description: The spectrum of the ring of infinitely differentiable functions on the real line.
